DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Biopsy Specimen Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information relating to the position or site on the body from which a sample of tissue is collected for pathologic analysis to determine if Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) is present._the anatomic location on the body related to involvement or assessment of Kaposi Sarcoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Biopsy Specimen Anatomic Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the position or site on the body from which a sample of tissue is collected for pathologic analysis to determine if Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) is present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:Relating to anatomy.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Relating to anatomy.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the anatomic location on the body related to involvement or assessment of Kaposi Sarcoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bottom one of two.: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the right side of the body.

Concepts.definition: The bottom one of two.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: That portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The dorsal area between the base of the neck and the sacrum.

Concepts.definition: The dorsal area between the base of the neck and the sacrum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition with most recent NCIt version. mc 2/15/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

Concepts.definition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior or superior part of an animal, containing the brain, or chief ganglia of the nervous system, the mouth, and in the higher animals, the chief sensory organs. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: The anterior and superior part of a human bearing the mouth, the brain and sensory organs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the wrist and located on the left side of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The terminal part of the lower extremity, especially the part below the ankle.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The structure found below the ankle joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: One of the two lower extremities in humans used for locomotion and support.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.

Concepts.definition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The pouch that encloses the testicles.: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

Concepts.definition: The musculocutaneous pouch that encloses the testicles.

The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.
